channel.title: Max
channel.description: Why cant i get more then 6 players on my server until it starts lagging and kicking people off..? the max players i sset to 30 so wtf...its hamachi anyone please help..

item.title: Max
item.dc:creator: @J03RY J03RY
item.description:
@J03RY wrote:

Go to your control panel and then klick System

If you cant find control panel just type “control manel” in your adress bar (wont work on IE7 and firefox)
then there will be an icon that looks like a computer. the file is called System.
Dubble klick it and your computer speed,model, lisence code and so on will be there. but also your RAM MB

Read full topic

item.title: Max
item.dc:creator: @i_own_i1 i--own--i
item.description:
@i_own_i1 wrote:

how do i find out how much ram my computer has? i know a bit about my computers not alot though.
Also i got 60gb space on my computer and only 11gb used so why would there be so much ram used?

Read full topic

item.title: Max
item.dc:creator: @J03RY J03RY
item.description:
@J03RY wrote:

Well, you could buy some RAM sticks wich you put in your computer (on your mainboard) and they expand it.
Or you could use a program called XPTools there is a function in there wich allows you to take memory from your hard disk and use it as virtual memory (RAM)

but thats limited so you could expand it from like 660 to 970 or someting but after like 9-10hours you would need to do it again becouse thats just a temporarly solution

Read full topic

item.title: Max
item.dc:creator: @J03RY J03RY
item.description:
@J03RY wrote:

Its your computer.
The more RAM you got the more players it can accept without lagging.
Thats the main reason why people are using deticated hosts instead of there own computer to put a server online.

You would need atleast 650+ Mb ram to have a decent server wich could handle about 15-30Players.
And then you would need atleast 1Gig of RAM to let it handle 30-60 Players.

So just buy a new computer wich has anough RAM memory to keep hosting your server or pay for a deticated host.

Read full topic
